episodeTitle: A Mansion in Chaos! An Enraged Don and an Imprisoned Crew
episodeTitleJapanese: 大混乱の館！怒るドンと囚われの一味
episodeTitleRomanized: Daikonran no Yakata! Ikaru Don to Toraware no Ichimi
description: Don Accino reveals his powerful Atsu Atsu no Mi devil fruit abilities. The Straw Hat crew members find themselves trapped in an ice cavern, but manage to escape with Robin's help. Meanwhile, Luffy battles the twin brothers Brindo and Campacino, and Puzzle regains his determination to reclaim the Phoenix Pirates' flag.

events.title: Luffy vs Brindo and Campacino Continue Fighting
events.description: Luffy continues his battle with the twin brothers Brindo and Campacino on the icy terrain. The twins use their magnetic abilities and the slippery ice to their advantage, constantly taunting Luffy while bragging about their strength.
events.significance: Demonstrates the ongoing conflict between the Straw Hats and the Accino Family members, showing the twins' fighting style and their reliance on environmental advantages.

events.title: Don Accino Reveals Atsu Atsu no Mi Powers
events.description: Don Accino confronts Zoro and reveals his Devil Fruit ability - the Atsu Atsu no Mi (Hot-Hot Fruit). He demonstrates his power to heat his body to extreme temperatures and melt any substance, explaining that he can reach temperatures of 10,000 degrees.
events.significance: First major demonstration of Don Accino's Devil Fruit abilities, establishing him as a formidable antagonist with powers that can counter physical attacks. This power reveal is crucial for understanding the main conflict of the Ice Hunter Arc.

quotes.text: I ate the Atsu Atsu no Mi! I have the power to melt any substance!
quotes.speaker: Don Accino
quotes.context: Don Accino reveals his Devil Fruit power to Zoro

events.title: Zoro's 108 Pound Phoenix Attack Fails
events.description: Zoro attempts to attack Don Accino with his 108 Pound Phoenix (Hyaku Hachi Pound Hō) technique, but the attack proves ineffective against the Don's extreme heat, which melts or deflects the air-based slash.
events.significance: Demonstrates the limitations of conventional attacks against Don Accino's Devil Fruit powers and establishes the challenge the Straw Hats face in this arc.

events.title: Arbell Interrupts Zoro's Attack
events.description: Just as Zoro prepares to attack Don Accino again, Arbell (Don Accino's daughter) suddenly intervenes, interrupting the battle and preventing Zoro from continuing his assault on her father.
events.significance: Shows the family loyalty within the Accino Family and sets up Zoro's capture, preventing an early confrontation between Zoro and Don Accino.

events.title: Straw Hats Imprisoned in Ice Cavern
events.description: Zoro, Nami, Sanji, Usopp, and Franky are captured and imprisoned together in an ice cavern by the Accino Family. The crew members find themselves trapped in the cold, icy prison created by the Ice Hunter bounty hunters.
events.significance: Represents a low point for the Straw Hats as most of the crew is captured, raising the stakes and creating tension for how they will escape and overcome the Accino Family.

events.title: Robin Remains with Lil
events.description: While the other Straw Hats are imprisoned, Robin remains separate from the group, staying with Lil (Don Accino's youngest daughter) who has befriended her. Robin agrees to attend Lil's birthday party.
events.significance: Establishes a unique dynamic where Robin is not imprisoned with the others, creating an opportunity for her to help from the inside. Shows Robin's diplomatic approach and Lil's innocence compared to her family members.

events.title: Robin Secretly Helps the Imprisoned Crew
events.description: Robin uses her position with Lil to secretly assist the imprisoned Straw Hats. She manages to get them cola from Lil, which is crucial for Franky to regain his strength and help with the escape plan.
events.significance: Demonstrates Robin's strategic thinking and ability to work undercover. The cola delivery becomes essential for the crew's escape, as Franky needs cola to power his abilities.

events.title: Franky Uses Cola to Free the Crew
events.description: With the cola provided by Robin through Lil, Franky powers up and uses his abilities to break through the ice prison. He successfully frees himself along with Zoro, Nami, Sanji, and Usopp from the ice cavern.
events.significance: Marks the turning point where the captured Straw Hats escape their imprisonment, allowing them to regroup and continue the fight against the Accino Family. Showcases Franky's importance to the crew and his mechanical abilities.

events.title: Puzzle Overcomes His Depression
events.description: Puzzle, the captain of the Phoenix Pirates who had fallen into despair after losing his crew's flag and his vice-captain Vigaro in the New World, begins to regain his determination. With encouragement from both Luffy and his young crew member Jiro, Puzzle overcomes his depression.
events.significance: Represents character growth for Puzzle and shows Luffy's ability to inspire others. This moment is crucial for the Phoenix Pirates storyline within the Ice Hunter Arc.

events.title: Puzzle Commits to Retrieving the Pirate Flags
events.description: Having regained his spirit, Puzzle makes the decision to accompany Luffy, Chopper, and Jiro to Lovely Land's flag collection to retrieve the stolen pirate flags, including his own crew's precious flag.
events.significance: Solidifies Puzzle's alliance with the Straw Hats and sets up the continuation of the assault on the Accino Family's stronghold. Shows Puzzle returning to his role as a captain willing to fight for his crew's honor.

events.title: Luffy's Battle with Twins Ends in Stalemate
events.description: The battle between Luffy and the twin brothers Brindo and Campacino ends inconclusively as both fighters depart to appease Don Accino. The twins leave to report to their father rather than continuing the fight.
events.significance: Leaves the conflict with the twins unresolved, suggesting they may face Luffy again later. Shows that the Accino Family's loyalty to Don Accino takes priority over their individual battles.

events.title: Hockera Returns Submarine to Lovely Land
events.description: Hockera, one of Don Accino's children, successfully returns the submarine to Lovely Land, shattering the ice surrounding it and securing it as a trophy for the Accino Family.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Accino Family's ongoing success in capturing the Straw Hats' belongings and adds to the list of items the crew needs to reclaim.

quotes.text: I ate the Atsu Atsu no Mi! I have the power to melt any substance!
quotes.speaker: Don Accino
quotes.context: Revealing his Devil Fruit powers to Zoro

themes.description: The episode emphasizes themes of overcoming despair and imprisonment. Puzzle overcomes his depression with encouragement, while the captured Straw Hats work together to escape their icy prison.
themes.symbolism: The ice prison represents the obstacles and setbacks the characters face, while their escape symbolizes resilience and teamwork.

themes.description: The Accino Family's dynamics are on display, with children like Arbell protecting their father and following his orders, even at the cost of their own battles.
themes.symbolism: The family structure of the Accino Family serves as a contrast to the chosen family dynamic of the Straw Hat Pirates.

themes.description: Don Accino's Devil Fruit reveal demonstrates the vast power differences in the One Piece world, while Zoro's failed attack shows that raw strength alone isn't always enough.
themes.symbolism: The extreme heat of the Atsu Atsu no Mi represents overwhelming power that requires strategy, not just force, to overcome.

characterSpotlights.development: Don Accino's true power is revealed through his Atsu Atsu no Mi demonstration, establishing him as the main threat of the arc with his ability to reach 10,000 degrees and melt any substance.
keyActions: Reveals his Atsu Atsu no Mi Devil Fruit powers
Demonstrates his ability to melt substances and withstand attacks
Confronts Zoro directly, showing his dominance
quotes: I ate the Atsu Atsu no Mi! I have the power to melt any substance!

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro faces a powerful Devil Fruit user whose abilities counter his sword-based attacks, showing the challenges the crew faces in this arc.
keyActions: Uses 108 Pound Phoenix technique without success
Gets imprisoned in the ice cavern after Arbell's intervention

characterSpotlights.development: Franky's mechanical abilities and cola-powered strength prove essential to the crew's survival, as he breaks them free from imprisonment.
keyActions: Receives cola from Robin through Lil
Breaks through the ice prison to free the crew

characterSpotlights.development: Robin demonstrates her intelligence and adaptability by working from within the Accino Family's mansion, using her connection with Lil to help her imprisoned crewmates.
keyActions: Stays with Lil instead of being imprisoned
Agrees to attend Lil's birthday party
Secretly provides cola to the imprisoned crew through Lil

characterSpotlights.development: Puzzle transitions from a depressed, defeated captain to someone willing to fight again for his crew's honor, inspired by Luffy and encouraged by Jiro.
keyActions: Receives encouragement from Luffy and Jiro
Overcomes his depression about losing in the New World
Commits to joining Luffy to retrieve the pirate flags

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Ice Hunter Arc, including this episode, is anime-only filler and does not appear in the manga. The arc was created to allow the manga to get further ahead.

trivia.fact: Don Accino's Atsu Atsu no Mi has a canonical counterpart - Charlotte Oven's Netsu Netsu no Mi, which appears much later in the series. Both fruits allow the user to generate extreme heat, though they have some differences in application.

sources.title: One Piece: 6 Non-Canon Devil Fruits That Got A Canonical Counterpart

trivia.fact: The Ice Hunter Arc is considered one of the weaker filler arcs in One Piece by many fans, with critics noting it feels overly long at 10 episodes and lacks the excitement of canon arcs.

sources.title: One Piece | Ice Hunter Arc | Summary, Recap, & Review

trivia.fact: This episode aired approximately one year after the end of the Enies Lobby Arc in the manga, as the anime needed filler content to avoid catching up to the source material.
Starting from episode 279, ending themes were discontinued in One Piece to allow for longer opening sequences. Episode 332 follows this format with only an opening theme and no ending theme.

sources.title: Why did the anime stop having ending songs since episode 279?
